intro: Bocagea dalzellii, commonly known as the dwarf waxplant, is a flowering shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces small, fragrant white or pink flowers during the winter months. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Bocagea dalzellii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and resilience in mild climates.
